content:
TITLE: Basic FetchFox Scraping with Callback Style
DESCRIPTION: Example of using FetchFox to scrape Pokemon data using the callback approach. Demonstrates initialization, data extraction, and result handling.
SOURCE: https://github.com/fetchfox/fetchfox/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-11_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { fox } from 'fetchfox';

const workflow = await fox
  .init('https://pokemondb.net/pokedex/national')
  .extract({ name: 'Pokemon name', number: 'Pokemon number' })
  .limit(3)
  .plan();

const results = await workflow
  .run(null, (delta) => { console.log(delta.item) });
  
for (const item of results.items) {
  console.log('Item:', item);
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Multi-level URL Following Scraping
DESCRIPTION: Advanced example showing how to scrape data across multiple pages by following URLs to detail pages
SOURCE: https://github.com/fetchfox/fetchfox/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-11_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const workflow = await fox
  .init('https://pokemondb.net/pokedex/national')
  .extract({ 
    url: 'URL of pokemon profile', 
    name: 'Pokemon name', 
    number: 'Pokemon number'
  })
  .extract({ 
    hp: 'Pokemon HP', 
    attack: 'Pokemon attack power', 
  })
  .limit(3)
  .plan();

const results = await workflow
  .run(null, (delta) => { console.log(delta.item) });
  
for (const item of results.items) {
  console.log('Item:', item);
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: FetchFox Streaming Style Scraping
DESCRIPTION: Alternative approach using streaming style to scrape Pokemon data, showing how to process results as they arrive
SOURCE: https://github.com/fetchfox/fetchfox/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-11_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { fox } from 'fetchfox';

const stream = fox
  .init('https://pokemondb.net/pokedex/national')
  .extract({ name: 'Pokemon name', number: 'Pokemon number' })
  .stream();

for await (const delta of stream) {
  console.log(delta.item);
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing FetchFox and Playwright Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install the FetchFox package and required Playwright dependencies
SOURCE: https://github.com/fetchfox/fetchfox/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-11_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm i fetchfox
npx playwright install-deps
npx playwright install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring OpenAI API Key in Code
DESCRIPTION: Example of setting up FetchFox with an OpenAI API key and model configuration directly in the code
SOURCE: https://github.com/fetchfox/fetchfox/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-11_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { fox } from 'fetchfox';

const results = await fox
  .config({ ai: ['openai:gpt-4o-mini', { apiKey: 'sk-your-key' }]})
  .init('https://pokemondb.net/pokedex/national')
  .extract({ name: 'Pokemon name', number: 'Pokemon number' })
  .limit(3)
  .run();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting OpenAI API Key via Environment Variable
DESCRIPTION: Example of running FetchFox with an OpenAI API key set through environment variables
SOURCE: https://github.com/fetchfox/fetchfox/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-11_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-your-key node index.js
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring OpenRouter API Integration
DESCRIPTION: Example of using FetchFox with OpenRouter to access alternative AI models like Google's Gemini
SOURCE: https://github.com/fetchfox/fetchfox/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-11_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const results = await fox
  .config({ ai: ['openrouter:google/gemini-flash-1.5', { apiKey: 'your-openrouter-key' }]})
  .init('https://pokemondb.net/pokedex/national')
  .extract({ name: 'Pokemon name', number: 'Pokemon number' })
  .limit(3)
  .run();
```
